recentPerformance.seasonAverage: 10.1 YPG (81 yards on 27 carries over 8 games)
recentPerformance.cushion: Expected 5-8 rushing yards vs elite pass rush

keyFactors.title: Denver's Historic Pass Rush
keyFactors.description: Led NFL with 40 sacks entering game (on pace for record 72). 41.0% pressure rate (1st in NFL) with 52.1% pass rush win rate (6th). Eliminated scrambling windows.

keyFactors.title: Raiders Offensive Line Catastrophe
keyFactors.description: Missing LT Kolton Miller (IR). Lost 2 more linemen during game. Three linemen missing/injured forced immediate pressure on 13 dropbacks.

keyFactors.title: Age and Mobility Profile
keyFactors.description: 35-year-old Smith not a designed rushing threat. Career rushing profile: 3-5 YPG (pocket passer). Near zero designed rush attempts (scrambles only). Only 3 carries typical for passing downs.

keyFactors.title: Game Script - Pass-Heavy Expected
keyFactors.description: Raiders 9.5-point underdogs necessitating passing. Smith leading NFL with 11 interceptions (forced into quick reads). 11 MPH winds at Empower Field impacted passing but didn't encourage rushing.

keyFactors.title: Historical Performance vs Denver
keyFactors.description: Only 2 QBs threw 300+ yards all season vs Denver. Elite pass rush + diminished protection = expected 5-8 rushing yards. Historical under rate in similar matchups: ~75%.

riskFactors: Smith averaged 10.1 YPG with functional offensive line (line set at 10.5)
One breakaway scramble could push over
Designed QB run play calls (though historically rare)

quarterBreakdown.description: Smith scrambled twice under pressure for 5 yards total. Denver's pass rush immediately established dominance. Raiders trailed 3-0.
One designed roll-out for 2 yards. Smith sacked 3 times in quarter. Pass protection completely collapsed. 3-0 Broncos at half.
Zero rush attempts. Smith suffered quad injury limiting mobility further. Pressure forced quick releases.
No additional rush attempts. Denver's 6 sacks (46 season total, historic pace) eliminated any scrambling opportunities.

gameResults.whenCleared: Line was safe by halftime with only 7 rushing yards. Never in danger as Smith had zero rush attempts in entire 2nd half.
gameResults.gamePace: Low-scoring defensive battle (17 total points). Raiders had only 10 first downs entire game. 188 total offensive yards for Raiders vs. 220 for Denver.
gameResults.foulTrouble: Smith suffered quad injury in Q4, further limiting mobility and ensuring zero additional rushing.

whatWentRight.title: Pass Rush Dominance (PRIMARY FACTOR)
whatWentRight.description: Denver's 6 sacks (46 season total, historic pace) completely eliminated scrambling windows. Smith had no time to escape pocket. Pressure forced 61.5% completion rate (vs. 67.2% season average).

whatWentRight.title: Offensive Line Collapse
whatWentRight.description: Three linemen missing/injured forced immediate pressure on 13 dropbacks. Smith never had clean pocket to operate. O-line catastrophe made rushing impossible.

whatWentRight.title: Conservative Game Script
whatWentRight.description: Raiders trailed throughout, necessitating passing (143 yards passing). Only 3 rush attempts vs. season average 3.4 per game. Age/mobility: 35-year-old Smith not a designed rushing threat.

whatWentRight.title: In-Game Injury
whatWentRight.description: Smith suffered quad injury in Q4, further limiting mobility. Zero rush attempts in entire 2nd half locked in the under.

statisticalContext.vsRecentForm: +5.6 yards vs last 3 games avg (1.4 YPG)

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: Expected outcome based on convergent factors. Denver's elite pass rush + diminished offensive line protection in a pass-heavy game script created perfect environment for under. The 10.5 line failed to account for convergence of Denver's historic sack rate, Raiders' O-line injuries, and Smith's advanced age limiting designed runs. True probability exceeded market by 25+ percentage points.

closingLineValue.verdict: Positive CLV (+10 cents). Line moved toward Under as sharp money recognized the mismatch. Early bet captured value before market fully adjusted to O-line injuries and pass rush dominance.

keyTakeaways: Elite pass rush vs. depleted offensive line creates massive edge for rushing unders on pocket passers
Age and mobility profile matter significantly - 35-year-old Smith not a scrambling threat
Game script indicators (9.5-point underdog) correctly predicted pass-heavy approach
Convergent factors (pass rush + O-line injuries + game script) create high-probability outcomes
Historical under rate in similar matchups (~75%) validated by 80% true probability estimate
In-game injuries provided additional cushion but bet was never in danger
verdict: Perfect process and execution. Multiple convergent factors created 25+ percentage point edge over market. True probability (78-82%) far exceeded implied probability (52.38%). Classic example of defensive mismatch exploitation.
